reviewText: If you think you know Marilyn Manson simply because you've read about him and listen to his music on a daily basis, well I've got news for you: You don't know jack$h!% until you've watched this video! Even the most devoted fans might be shocked or even offended by what they see on this 60 minute film about the controversial band's "Antichrist Superstar" concert tour. In the first 5 minutes of the video, you'll see footage of christians singing gospel hymns & witnessing to Manson fans outside of the arenas before the concerts. As an atheist, I bursted out laughing at the lengths that these christians went to just to get their message across to all of the Manson fans. Singing, dancing, praying, preaching from the bible, holding signs that say "Manson, Jesus Loves You" and stuff like that, it was just funny. Then the cameras take us inside the arena as Manson appears on stage to kick things off by singing "The Angel With the Scabbed Wings." Manson is interviewed throughout the program and explains why he hates christianity so much and how he feels when religious people attack him & refuse to let their children come to see him perform. There's a lot of blurred faces and disguised voices on this tape, and can be a bit annoying. Even Manson's voice during some of the interviews sounds audibly crasp, but if you've got good hearing, you should be able to make out what he's saying. Other live songs include Kinderfield, Sweet Dreams, Antichrist Superstar, Lunchbox, and Apple of Sodom, which I consider to be my favorite song on the video. Also, you'll see clips of Manson performing 1996 and Rock 'n' Roll N*****. Manson is a very outspoken speaker and exercises it by giving some interesting speeches at various concerts. A lot of the backstage footage is rather tasteless & very shocking, so don't watch this tape if you're easily offended. Don't say I didn't warn you! This video contains nudity, strong language, disturbing images, and mature subject matter.
summary: Marilyn Manson ~ Dead To the World

reviewText: I was shocked when I was the opening scene for this tape. I was only fifteen when I first viewed this tape. The drugs, nudity and disturbing images were pretty cool to me then, and are even more intresting now than ever. I give this one four stars because most of the concert is recorded with an open mic thus making the sound a B+ for quality. Here you get ten live songs and back stage footage. Get this if you haven't seen Manson live that's all I have to say.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When i was younger, the tour on this tape came to the civic center in my city, and that was the first i had heard of manson.  I did not go(it sold out pretty quickly), now after watching this video, i am mad for not going!  The video starts out with protestors and then cuts to the concert footage with "Angel with the scabbed wings", then it has backstage footage, and more concerts, and so on.  He does amazing on stage, he sounds good, and is not afraid to go to the extremes.  If you are easily offended, this video is DEFFINETLY NOT FOR YOU!!!  But, if you are like me, and love both marilyn manson and shock factor, then you must get this tape.  I have watched this tape almost more than i have listened to the cds.  I am addicted, and i am loving it!!  YOU MUST BUY IT NOW!!!!
summary: Better than God is in the tv!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, now before all you Manson fans want to kill me, let me explain something, I am a huge MM fan, this movie was just really disapointing. I kept waiting for there to be like some meat to the film, to tie all the loose ends together, but it never happened. When manson was interviewed the sound quality ...., and all through out the movie the camera jumped around far too much. When they were backstage with the band, I would start to look at one of the members and check out his make up and hair and all and then the camera would turn away, I was like, geezus, give me a second. it was irritating. One awesome freaky thing though, was when Manson came out on stilts to sing"Kinderfeld," that was great. I basically expected more from this film because of all the hype it got from all of you, I don't understand it, God Is In The Tv was a much much much better choice, which I do own and watch frequently. I am glad that I bought this simply because it's more MM for me, but take my word for it, if you're going to buy one of their movie things, please buy God Is In The TV.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The video contains a 1996 documentary of the controversial Antichrist Superstar tour. The video features 10 songs from the Antichrist Superstar album and the albums before it. Manson delivers a chaotic performance through every one of the songs.Aside from the live performances there are also segments of behind the scenes footage of the band as well as the protesters who tried so very hard to stop the show from happening. Manson briefly states his philosophy in his commentaries.See U In The Future...
summary: Dead to the world, Satan has come!

reviewText: I'd totally forgotten about this movie, I loaned it to a friend years ago and just had it pop up after completing another review. Ah my Manson-y youth :) I loved Manson as a teenager and still consider his music my own little personal rebellion and what made me think outside the box as far as religion is concerned. If you love Manson, want to re-live some memories and it's available on DVD (mine was VHS), buy it and enjoy!
